Semitic *katab- "to prick, cut, scratch, scrape", secondary: kitab CUT-AB / C'TAB

𒋰 TAB double
𒁾 TUB DUB tab tablet

𒆍 kit 𒆤 KID

כ־ת־ב k-t-b ك ت ب k-t-b (strong root) forming words pertaining to writing

𓏛 𓏏 𓏤 | book | 𓏛 que 𓏏 𓏤 top kitab кьтап k̍tap

כְּתָב k'táv writing, script, handwriting
כְּתִיבָה ktivá writing
כְּתִיב ktiv notation, spelling, orthography
כָּזָב kazáv lie deceive mislead ⇔ logo⇔Lüge
כַּתָּב katáv a newspaper correspondent
כְּתַב יָד k'táv yád handwriting, manuscript
כְּתַב יְתֵדוֹת k'tav y'tedót cuneiform < وَتِد watid יָתֵד yatéd stake, peg, rod
מִכְתָּב mikhtáv A letter: a written message, a piece of written correspondence.

𓌨 𓂋 𓏏 𓂝 𓅪 𓏥 | deceit | kurtab > kitab כָּזָב kazáv ! 𓅪 ⋍ 𓅙 taube/dove
